data.title: Cannot install extensions due to "Cannot read property 'call' of undefined"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 (1.7.2)
- OS Version:  macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open extensions tab
2. See error "Cannot read property 'call' of undefined"
3. Search for any extension (works)
4. Tap install
5. See error "Cannot read property 'call' of undefined"

As a workaround I install things via console, i.e.:
> $ code --install-extension saviorisdead.RustyCode

data.title: Error: monaco.d.ts is no longer up to date.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Master
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Hi I have installed:
VS2015,
 Visual C++ build tools, 
Node 6.x, 
npm@3.10.8, set 
git config --global core.autocrlf true, 
npm config set python C:\Python27\python.exe
git config --global core.autocrlf true

Tried to build win32 version but it keeps failing at the same point " Error: monaco.d.ts is no longer up to date. "

data.title: Avoid fs.sync calls in renderer and extension host
data.body:
We should try to avoid sync fs calls where possible because they just block code execution until finished. We typically never had sync fs calls in the renderer but now I am seeing more and more of them, also in the extension host:

* [x] [`SnippetsTracker`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/snippets/electron-browser/snippetsTracker.ts#L40)
* [x] [`Terminal`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/execution/electron-browser/terminal.ts#L10)
* [x] [`Emmet`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/emmet/node/actions/base64.ts#L39)
* [x] [`cli.contribution`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/cli/electron-browser/cli.contribution.ts#L41)
* [x] [`ExtensionHostMain`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostMain.ts#L73)
* [x] [`Main`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/main.ts#L119)
* [x] [`exthost.api.impl`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts#L450)

data.title: Completions filtered until there is at least one matching character
data.body:
1.8 head Have the following code: ```html
<
``` - do code assist after < - you should get more than one proposal, such as 'div', 'span', ... Bug is in completionModel.ts, _createCachedState: leadingLineContent.slice(-wordLen); For word.length === 0 you will get back the full leadingLineContent (' <'), not the empty word.

data.title: Avoid sync fs-calls in backupMainService

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The `backupMainService` runs synchronous fs-operations on start up. Worst the amount of sync-operations doesn't seem to have an upper bound but perf depends on the number and size of dirty files. All other startup-operations, like establishing IPC channels or setting up telemetry etc, have to wait for this which is bad. Instead, the backup-service should perform async fs operations, and waiting should happen as late as possible, e.g. *before* showing the window but *after* running other startup-tasks.

data.title: Running multiple cmd tasks in tasks.json seem too mutually excluce themselves
data.body:
Hi, I'm creating a build task to run tsc to get compilation errors and tslint to see the warnings I've got defined for project. I just can run one task at a time, if I put isBuildCommand to more than one task only the first seems to be executed.

Note: I also have TSLint extension by egamma

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use the following tasks.json:

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "args": [
        "/C"
    ],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Build Type Script",
            "suppressTaskName": true,
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "args": [
                "tsc -p ."
            ],
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
        },
        {
            "taskName": "tslint",
            "suppressTaskName": true,
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "args": [
                "tslint src/**/*.ts{,x} test/**/*.ts{,x} --project tsconfig.json"
            ],
            "problemMatcher": {
                "owner": "tslint",
                "fileLocation": [
                    "relative",
                    "${workspaceRoot}"
                ],
                "severity": "warning",
                "pattern": {
                    "regexp": "^(\\S.*)\\[(\\d+), (\\d+)\\]:\\s+(.*)",
                    "file": 1,
                    "line": 2,
                    "column": 3,
                    "message": 4
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

2. Do ctrl+shift+b

3. Depending on the order of the tasks I just see errors (tsc) or warning (tslint)

Is this a bug or it's just the way it works for now?

data.title: When you try to pull (or checkout) with pending changes an incorrect message is provided
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a project that is linked to remote a git repositoty.
2. Do a clone in another dir or ask a friend to modify a file, commit, and push.
3. Modify the same file locally and try to pull.

You will get an error saying (emphasis mine):
> Can't pull. Please commit or **stage** your work first.

Meanwhile, in the git console you see a different and _correct_ error:

> Please commit your changes or **stash** them before you merge.

The error is that "stash" is the correct action, staging won't help.
Here is the line https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/3407c06a91ca4aabd9cf97c31f99622c908bee4d/src/vs/workbench/parts/git/browser/gitActions.ts#L938

data.title: Feature suggestion: cursorColumnStart and cursorColumnEnd

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`cursorColumnStart` and `cursorColumnEnd` or similar would assist in navigating paragraphs quickly. It would always keep the column position and jump vertically skipping white space (beginning of line and end of line). It is especially convenient when navigating indented code, as one can adjust the granularity of movement by moving left/right and then continuing skipping up/down.

I often use `cursorWordStartLeft`/`cursorWordEndRight`, and `cursorHome`/`cursorEnd`, so this would be a nice companion to those.

- VSCode Version:  1.6.1

1)Create an extension using the client/server model as described in the documentation
2)Try to debug the server as describer in the documentation https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/extensions/example-language-server by pressing f5/attaching node
3)Debugging doesn't work. The server goes to debug mode (you see the top bar with the pause/disconnect/etc buttons), you can set breakpoints, but they never get triggered. Debug console doesn't show anything.

My codebase is very similar to the example codebase found in the docs, so it should be easy to reproduce. Not sure whether it's a real bug or simply the docs are outdated and something else is missing to make this work.

data.title: Consume languageServiceEnabled Events from TS
data.body:
fixes #15208

**Bug**
We currently use our own logic to determine if a TS project contains too many files. The actual TS server may use different criteria for determining this.

**Fix**
For TS 2.1.3+, listen for languageServiceEnabled events from the TS server instead.
